What's New in Extensions?

Google Chrome 6

  • New APIs
    • The Context Menus API allows you to add context menus to pages or specific objects on a page
    • The Cookies API allows you to manage the browser's cookie system
    • The Idle API allows you to detect when the machine's idle state changes
  • Manifest Changes
    • The geolocation permission gives an extension access to the user's physical location
    • Match patterns can now select all schemes or all urls
    • Access to file:/// URLs no longer triggers the "access to your machine" security warning, but now requires user opt-in from the extension management page
  • Additions to existing APIs
    • chrome.extension.getViews() can now return popup views
    • Added WINDOW_ID_NONE constant for when focus shifts away from the browser
    • The chrome.tabs.getCurrent() method returns the tab associated with the currently executing script
  • New experimental APIs
    • The Omnibox API allows you to add functionality to the browser's omnibox
    • The Infobars API allows you to add UI panels across the top of a tab
